title: Drying Meat for Long-Term Storage
brief: Air-dry meat into jerky using sun and airflow for preservation without fire.
steps: Step 1: Cut meat into 6-millimeter strips along the grain direction.
Step 2: Hang meat strips on a rack in direct sunlight with good air circulation.
Step 3: Keep strips out of reach of animals and insects.
Step 4: Cover meat to protect from flies while allowing airflow.
Step 5: Allow meat to dry thoroughly - properly dried meat will be dry and crisp.
Step 6: Test by touch - dried meat should not feel cool to the touch.
warnings: Protect from flies and insects which can contaminate or lay eggs in meat.
Ensure complete drying - partially dried meat will spoil quickly.
Choose sunny location with good airflow for best results.
source: FM21-76 US Army Survival Manual — U.S. Department of the Army
